comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
As far as I understand, this issue is about `Stealth mode` - `Hide your Referrer from third-parties`.
If so, it's not related to filters.

It might be related to this - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForWindows/issues/4570
If not, then please open issue in relevant repository - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForMac/issues

Regarding second rule:
```adblock
imdb.com#$?#body:has(div[data-testid="promptable"]:has(.ipc-rating-display-with-poster__image)) { overflow: auto !important; }
```

If I'm not wrong, it's not necessary to use `:has` two times, something like this:
```adblock
imdb.com#$?#body:has(div[data-testid="promptable"] .ipc-rating-display-with-poster__image) { overflow: auto !important; }
```
should match the same element.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -7,6 +7,8 @@
 !
 ! SECTION: Popups - Regular rules
 !
+imdb.com#$?#div[data-testid="promptable"]:has(.ipc-rating-display-with-poster__image) { display: none !important; }
comment.body:
` { display: none !important; }` is not necessary for `#?#` rules - they won't apply on content blockers. So, this part of the rule should be removed.
@AdamWr @BlazDT could you check it on your side? I don't have the popup.

issue.title: imdb.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.46.0 with the latest version of filter_14_Annoyances

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0105226/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

The following lines from `filter_14_Annoyances` are disabling the rate button (1st line) and messing with the margin when clicking the rate button (2nd line).

imdb.com#$#div[data-testid="promptable"] { display: none !important; }
imdb.com#$?#body { overflow: auto !important; }

Can be tested on any movie page on IMDB.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: If the node is correctly unhidden: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/ExtendedCss/issues/77 https://github.com/AdguardTeam/ExtendedCss/issues/122 then this can be done with the help of ExtendedCSS "now" or CSS4 in the future (difference something other than text matchable only by `#?#... foo:contains(...)`).

comment.body:
Data related to the highlighted advertisement known as PowerLink exists in a non-advertisement dcinside.com web request.
If an adblocker blocks the request, this blocking will cause an error.
Please use Safari web browser instead of dcinside app.

<details><summary>Korean - 한국어</summary>

파워링크로 알려진 강조된 광고와 관련된 데이터는 광고가 아닌 디시인사이드 웹 요청에 존재합니다.
만약 광고 차단기가 그 요청을 차단하면, 이 차단은 애러를 일으킵니다.
디시인사이드 앱 대신에 Safari 웹 브라우저를 사용해주세요.

</details>

pull_request.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142875

Now only pop-up is blocked, which automatically appears (without a user request). That is, I solved the problems that were reported in #141159

<!-- # Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [ ] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;

pull_request.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/142875

Now only pop-up is blocked, which automatically appears (without a user request). That is, I solved the problems that were reported in #141159

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [ ] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [ ] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment



2. Screenshots

<details>

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>



</details>

### Terms

comment.body:
Although I assume you have good intention, please do not use this repo for your personal report. I also explicitly wrote I accept reports only from those who have a consistent Github account with some contribution history. I address this case only, if people keep trying circumvent the principle, I will just remove adblock2 repo and stop maintaing lists.
For the modal, add
```
shokunin-san.com#$##promote-modal { display: none !important; }
shokunin-san.com#$#body[style*="position: fixed"] { position: static !important; }
```
to User rules.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Prerequisites

This is not a tracking service, but is a [personalization tool](https://www.intellimize.com/). What is the process for getting an exception?

### Proposed solution

Add all intellimize domains to the whitelist

### Additional information

_No response_

Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Hi.
We need to know the source site. If redirect or opening of new tab is random, probably your system or browser is infected by [adware](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/adware)
Please scan your system using an antivirus. Also check for suspicious extensions in your browser settings.

comment.body:
> As far as I understand, to reproduce this issue a website with MonsterInsights WordPress plug-in installed is required. If so, unfortunately I cannot check it.
> 
> Could you please enable AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, open the logger/filtering log (in uBlock Origin), reproduce issue and make a screenshot with blocked requests?

Because uBlock Origin has removed AdGuard Tracking Protection, I had to manually add this list from here: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/AdguardTeam/FiltersRegistry/master/filters/filter_3_Spyware/filter.txt

I refreshed the page several times, and it did not happen.

I disabled uBlock Origin, re-enabled AdGuard AdBlocker for Microsoft Edge, and the issue happened here is the log of what was blocked on that page:

![Screenshot at 2023-02-15 13-10-38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46236743/219129221-22d7f5c5-ca11-4996-81cb-ccca38aa923f.png)
